Description: Small plaque of bone, three original sides preserved, front shows incised lines of a geometric decoration, maybe some sort of architecture or a throne side, with a ntr-sign in a surrounding line, the lines show a green glaze; the right side is smoothed and shows an protruding part like from a pedestal, the back shows straight incised lines again, parallel to the edge, while on the right part, where the object is broken off, a rounded line like a cartouche seems to have been
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Amara West (Nubia), Temple, forecourt, F14.6 (the west gate)
Bibliographic references: Spencer 1997 / Amara West I, The Architectural Report (p. 32)
